授業目的: This course prepares students for their study at the tertiary level including reading, writing, and presentation skills.
到達目標: After taking this course, students will have the basic skills for studying at the tertiary level including reading, writing, and presentation skills.
授業方法: Class discussion, reading and writing assignments, presentations.

トピック.授業計画1: Reading and writing assignments will be determined after consultation with students.
トピック.授業外学習2: Reading and writing assignments will be determined after consultation with students.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school.
By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
General Foundation Courses (Practical Orientation):
1. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
2. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
3. Ethical Values: Acquiring it though ‘liberal arts education for human growth’ based on Christian principles.
